x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: During natural disasters such as floods, wildfires, or hurricanes, local communities face challenges in coordinating relief efforts, tracking resource availability, and providing timely support to affected individuals. Current systems are fragmented, volunteers, NGOs, and local governments often work in silos, leading to delays in aid distribution, lack of visibility into on-ground needs, and inefficient use of available resources.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: Community Resilience Hub (CRH): Disaster Response & Support Portal
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

The Community Resilience Hub will serve as a centralized digital command center built on ServiceNow.
Citizens can report incidents, request help, or locate nearby shelters through a simple self-service portal.
Relief organizations and government agencies can monitor incidents in real-time using dashboards and assign volunteers or resources based on severity and location.
Automated workflows will trigger notifications to emergency responders and supply chain partners.
Integration with external weather and alert APIs will allow proactive preparation before disasters strike.
Post-disaster analytics will help authorities evaluate response effectiveness and improve planning for future events.


ServiceNow Products or Capabilities Used:
ServiceNow Customer Service Management (CSM): For citizen self-service portals and case management.
ServiceNow Field Service Management (FSM): To dispatch and track volunteers and relief teams.
ServiceNow Impact or Performance Analytics: For real-time dashboards and post-disaster impact reporting.
ServiceNow IntegrationHub: To connect with external APIs (weather data, emergency alerts).
ServiceNow Mobile App: To enable on-the-ground volunteers to update status, upload photos, and receive task notifications.
